page.title: 18Recollections of Street (3)
page.content:
{Mr.Monelle (a tailor}at the bottom of Vestry Road) was famous for shouting political arguments aimed at Mr. {Freddie Durston},who dozed outside {Hecks greengrocer's shop}opposite, always dressed in a{ragged suit,boots, {collarless shirt and cloth cap}and{who ignored him.{Mr Monelle}was clever at luring unsuspecting customers inside, and owned an{ancient parrot resembling {a stuffed chicken}which could imitate his voice thus causing much confusion.
{It was a most enjoyable glimpse of {the 1930's and of course,in 1939 the {second world war began and all their {lives changed.
